==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|座|敷|童|子}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|座敷童}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=さしきわらし'|座敷|tr1=zashiki|t1=house; Japanese-style room|童子|tr2=warashi|t2=regional dialect term for 'child'}}.

===Pronunciation===
* [[on'yomi|On'yomi]] + [[kan'yōyomi]].
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/zaɕiki waɽaɕi/}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ざしき わらし}}

# A kind of [[yōkai]]: a red-faced [[ghost]] or [[apparition]] of a child [[haunt]]ing an old house. Not [[malevolent]], it brings good fortune to the house so haunted. Appears in folk tales told in northeast Japan, particularly Iwate Prefecture.
